majors.major: SOCIOLOGY, Race and Racial Justice Emphasis, B.A.
general_texts:
Between the Fall 2025 and Fall 2027 application cycles, the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts

will not require transfer students to complete major specific selection criteria to be admitted to this major*.

Students wanting to enroll in this major will be admitted using UC Merced's general transfer requirements**.


* This only applies to certain SSHA majors.

** The General Transfer Requirements are as follows:


Units and GPA

  • Complete 60 semester (90 quarter) units of UC-transferable college credit
  • Earn a minimum grade point average of 2.40 (nonresident: 2.80) in UC-transferable courses
  • Take no more than 14 semester (21 quarter) units as Pass/Not Pass


Course Requirements/Subject Requirements

Complete the following seven-course pattern, earning a grade of C- or better in each course:

  • Two transferable English composition courses
  • One transferable mathematical concepts and quantitative reasoning course that has a published prerequisite of intermediate algebra
  • Four transferable courses chosen from at least two of the following areas: Arts and Humanities, Behavioral and Social Sciences, Biological and Physical Sciences


While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.

Recommended, but not Required Prior to Transfer:

  • SOC 001
  • At least one course from the following course ranges: SOC 011 - SOC 014 or SOC 016 - SOC 089
  • Complete the following courses: SOC 010 and SOC 015 (Highly recommended to be completed before transfer).
  • Complete the additional Lower Division Emphasis Track course: SOC 038


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts SOC 010


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations


Please read the catalog page for more information about the Sociology major.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

majors.major: ACCOUNTING, B.S. (Transfer Starting Fall 2028)
general_texts:
For Admissions to the Accounting, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.4 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes, all Major Preparation courses require a "C" or better. Open to transfer applicants beginning Fall 2028. The major is currently under development. Please check back for updated information and transfer selection criteria as they become available.


Major Preparation Courses: Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • ECON 001
  • ECON 005
  • ECON 006A
  • ECON 006B
  • ECON 007
  • ECON 010
  • ECON 050
  • MATH 011


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Economics: Both Macroeconomics And Microeconomics score of 4 or 5 exempts ECON 001
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB: score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011
  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

More information will become available in our 2026-2027 catalog about the Accounting, B.S. major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.


Prior to Transferring to UC Merced, please be advised of the following for Junior Transfers:


1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete IGETC in order to prepare for work within the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts (SSHA). IGETC courses may double count with the major courses listed below. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

general_texts:
For admission to the Aerospace Engineering, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by spring prior to fall enrollment or by fall prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED major preparation courses:

  • CHEM 002 & CHEM 002L
  • MATH 021
  • MATH 022
  • MATH 023
  • MATH 024
  • PHYS 008 & PHYS 008L
  • PHYS 009 & PHYS 009L


Additional Major Preparation Recommended Prior to Transfer:

  • Complete the following Computing Course: ME 021
  • Complete the following Engineering Fundamentals Courses: ENGR 045, ENGR 057 (Only Lower Division Courses listed)
  • Complete the following Mechanical Engineering Core Courses: ENGR 065, ENGR 091
  • Complete the following Additional Courses: MATH 032


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 & 002L and CHEM 010 & 010L
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021 and Math 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB score 3 or higher exempts Math 021
  • An AP Physics: Physics C: Mechanics score of 5 exempts PHYS 008 and PHYS 008L

general_titles: UPDATES TO THE INTRODUCTORY BIOLOGY COURSES
general_texts:
Effective Fall 2023, the introductory BIO course series for majors is changing and BIO 001/001L and BIO 002/002L are being discontinued. The course series is changing such that:


  • BIO 011 (Introduction to Molecular Biology) & BIO 011L (Introduction to Molecular Biology Lab) are equivalent to BIO 002 (Introduction to Molecular Biology) & BIO 002L (Introduction to Molecular Biology Lab), respectively
  • BIO 012 (Introduction to Organismal Biology) & BIO 012L (Introduction to Organismal Biology Lab) are equivalent to BIO 001 (Contemporary Biology) & BIO 001L (Contemporary Biology Lab), respectively

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Biological Sciences, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.8 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all Major Preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses For Transfer:

  • BIO 011 & BIO 011L (formerly BIO 002 & BIO 002L)
  • Starting for Fall 2025 applicants, BIO 011 & BIO 011L will replace BIO 002 & BIO 002L as the required major preparation course for the major.
  • Starting for Fall 2026 applicants, BIO 011 & BIO 011L and BIO 012 & BIO 012L will be required major preparation for the major.
  • CHEM 002 & CHEM 002L
  • CHEM 010 & CHEM 010L
  • MATH 011 or MATH 021


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended Prior to Transfer:

  • BIO 012 & BIO 012L (formerly BIO 001 & BIO 001L)
  • Starting for Fall 2025 applicants, BIO 012 & BIO 012L will replace BIO 001 & BIO 001L
  • PHYS 018 & PHYS 018L
  • Complete one course in Computer Science from: BIOE 21, CSE 019, CSE 022, DSC 011 or ME 021
  • Complete one course in Probability and Statistics from: BIO 018, DCS 008, ECON 010, MATH 032 or PSY 010


*Please scroll below for information about how Algebra/Trigonometry based Physics courses can be substituted for the Physics requirement for this major.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 & 002L and CHEM 010 & 10L
  • AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 OR MATH 021
  • AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 11 OR MATH 021
  • AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 OR MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB score 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • AP Physics: Physics C: Mechanics score of 5 exempts PHYS 018 and PHYS 018L
  • AP Statistics score of 4 exempts BIO 018, MATH 018 or PSY 010
  • AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

Please read the catalog page for more information about the Biological Sciences, B.A. program.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.


Prior to Transferring to UC Merced, please be advised of the following for Junior Transfers:


1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements.


IGETC/Cal-GETC is acceptable for students planning to transfer into the School of Natural Sciences. Students are encouraged to prioritize as much lower-division major preparation as possible before transferring to ensure a smooth transition and timely progress toward their degree.


Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

1. A year long Algebra or Trigonometry based Physics are acceptable substitutes for PHYS 018 & 018L for this major only.


2. California Community College, courses with C-IDs PHYS 105 and PHYS 110 or PHYS 100 S will be accepted towards the year-long Algebra or Trigonometry based Physic series for this major agreement only. Please refer to https://www.c-id.net/courses to find the course for your community college. As recommended, best practice is to discuss this option with your Community College Counselor.


3. Students electing to meet the requirement with algebra or trigonometry-based physics may be unable to take advanced, Upper Division courses in human physiology, biophysics and other courses requiring calculus-based physics. Upon enrollment, students should consult with their academic advisor on alternate course options.


4. Students will need to complete the full-year sequence of general physics or calculus-based physics in order to have the requirement satisfied. Students will not be able to mix and match non-calc with calc based physics due to the impact it will have with meeting prerequisite requirements.


5. If you decide on this option, upon transferring to UC Merced, please let your Academic Advisor know so they can help you with a course exemption override.

  • CHEM 010 & CHEM 010L

  • AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 OR MATH 021
  • AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 11 OR MATH 021

majors.major: CHEMICAL ENGINEERING, B.S. (Transfer Starting 2026)
general_texts: The undergraduate major in Chemical Engineering provides students with a solid foundation and the necessary skills to assume leadership roles in industry and government agencies. Chemical engineers are recruited and educated about design, synthesis, and processing of chemicals and materials in variety of industries including industrial chemicals and petroleum, environmental engineering, electronics, agriculture, food processing, and power generation. Chemical Engineering impacts society by providing efficient processes for making a range of products including nanotechnology, plastics, food, alternative fuels, and recycled products. Because of the variety of fields that are relevant to this profession, the undergraduate program covers a broad range of subjects, including chemistry, physics, materials, thermal/mass/fluids/heat transfer, as well as computer-aided engineering design, scale-up, and manufacturing. The innovative curriculum at UC Merced provides a rich educational experience that exposes students to engineering fundamentals, laboratory skills, unit operations, and advanced computational tools to solve realistic engineering problems.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Chemical Engineering, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.

  • CHEM 002 & CHEM 002L
  • MATH 021

  • PHYS 008 & PHYS 008L
  • PHYS 009 & PHYS 009L

  • Engineering Computing: ME 021
  • Basic Science elective: BIOE 002 or BIO 011 or BIO 011 & BIO 011L (Acceptable Substitute)


*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 & 002L and CHEM 010 & 010L
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021 and Math 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB score 3 or higher exempts Math 021

majors.major: COGNITIVE SCIENCE, B.A.
general_texts:
Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For Admission to the Cognitive Science, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes, all Major Preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED: Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • COGS 001 OR PSY 001*
  • PSY 010**
  • MATH 005 OR MATH 011 or MATH 021 (Allowable Substitute)


* If PSY 001 is used to meet the Required Major Preparation course for transfer, then COGS 001 will be required at UC Merced.

** PSY 010 also fulfills the Statistical Methods requirement for the major.


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended to be Completed Before Transfer:


  • Complete one Quantitative Reasoning Requirement: CSE 015 OR MATH 008 OR *MATH 011 (MATH 021 is an allowable Substitute) OR PHIL 005
  • Complete two Introductory courses: ANTH 001, ANTH 005, BIO 011, COGS 005, ECON 001, PHIL 001, POLI 001, **PSY 001 and SOC 001
  • Complete one introductory computing course: BIOE 021 OR CSE 005 OR CSE 019


* If using MATH 011 or MATH 021 to satisfy the Admissions requirement, the course also fulfills the Quantitative Reasoning Requirement.

** If using PSY 001 to satisfy the Admissions requirement, the course also fulfills one course for the Introductory requirement.

*** PSY 010 also fulfills one of the Required Major Preparation Course for Transfer


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade, and they may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions


  • An AP Computer Science: Comp Science A score of 3 or 4 exempts CSE 005
  • An AP Economics: Macroeconomics And Microeconomics score of 4 or 5 exempts ECON 001
  • An AP Government and Politics: United States score of 4 or 5 exempts POLI 001
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 005
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 or MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Psychology score of 4 or 5 exempts PSY 001
  • An AP Statistics score of 4 exempts BIO 018, PSY 010
  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

Please read the catalog major page for more information about Cognitive Science.

1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete IGETC in order to prepare for work within the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts (SSHA). Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Communication and Media, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment.


Applicants will at the time of admission have completed at least two the following courses

(or their equivalent) with a B or better:

COMM 001 Speech Traditions

COMM 002 Argument and Debate

COMM 003 Interpersonal Communication

COMM 004 Small Group Communication

COMM 015 Intercultural Communication (Coming Soon)

COMM 016 Forensics

COMM 017 Introduction to Media and Performance Studies (Coming Soon)

COMM 018 Introduction to Communication Theory

COMM 060 Introduction to Linguistics (Coming Soon)

CRES 001 Introduction to Critical Race and Ethnic Studies


Additional Major Preparation Courses (Recommend, but required prior to transfer)

Speech and Interpersonal Communication (8 units) -Complete two of the following courses: COMM 001, COMM 002, COMM 003, COMM 004

Introductory Social Science and Humanities (8 units)-Complete two of the following courses: COMM 015, COMM 017 or GASP 004, COMM 060, COMM 016, COMM 018, COMM 051 or GASP 003, CRES 001

COMM 001 Speech Traditions

COMM 016 Forensics

COMM 018 Introduction to Communication Theory

COMM 060 Introduction to Linguistics (Coming Soon)

CRES 001 Introduction to Critical Race and Ethnic Studies


Additional Major Preparation Courses (Recommended, but not required prior to transfer)

majors.major: CRITICAL RACE AND ETHNIC STUDIES, B.A.
general_texts:
Between the Fall 2025 and Fall 2027 application cycles, the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts

will not require transfer students to complete major specific selection criteria to be admitted to this major*.

Students wanting to enroll in this major will be admitted using UC Merced's general transfer requirements**.


* This only applies to certain SSHA majors.

** The General Transfer Requirements are as follows:


Units and GPA

  • Complete 60 semester (90 quarter) units of UC-transferable college credit
  • Earn a minimum grade point average of 2.40 (nonresident: 2.80) in UC-transferable courses
  • Take no more than 14 semester (21 quarter) units as Pass/Not Pass


Course Requirements/Subject Requirements

Complete the following seven-course pattern, earning a grade of C- or better in each course:

  • Two transferable English composition courses
  • One transferable mathematical concepts and quantitative reasoning course that has a published prerequisite of intermediate algebra
  • Four transferable courses chosen from at least two of the following areas: Arts and Humanities, Behavioral and Social Sciences, Biological and Physical Sciences


While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.


Recommended, but not Required Prior to Transfer:

  • CRES 001
  • Complete up to two of the following courses: CRES 027, ENG 063, GASP 065A (Other Upper Division Courses can also fulfill this requirement)
  • Complete up to two of the following courses: COGS 005, CRES 020, CRES 051, CRES 052, CRES 070, CRES 072B, CRES 076A, CRES 076B, ENG 031, ENG 064, GASP 003, GASP 007, HIST 017, SOC 038 (Other Upper Division Courses can also fulfill this requirement)


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade, and specifically may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • AP History: US History: score of 4 or 5 exempts HIST 016 and HIST 017


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations


Please read the catalog page for more information about the Critical Race and Ethnic Studies major.

majors.major: DATA SCIENCE AND ANALYTICS, B.A. (Transfer Starting Fall 2026)
general_titles: The Data Science and Analytics Major
general_texts:
The Data Science and Analytics (DSA) major-anticipated to be available for Transfer Students in Fall 2026- addresses the increasing demand for adept data analysts by combining coursework in applied data science with coursework in economics and cognitive, political and management science - areas where real-world problem solving increasingly relies on data-driven analysis to inform decision-making.


The reason for the increasing workforce demand is the ubiquity of data, which are generated everywhere, and increasingly envelop our human experience by mediating our interactions with the natural, social, and built world. Yet despite their prevalence, data are not necessarily generated in a way that are immediately usable or valuable. Instead, they require refinement, reformatting and critical analysis before they can be converted into something informative. In order to extract value that an individual or organization might use in order to make a decision-- i.e., raise or lower a tax, hire or dismiss within a department, or invest or divest in a particular sector - one needs to understand how to appropriately and ethnically apply methods of data science for harnessing and classifying the data, along with the methods of data analytics for extracting actionable insights and effectively communicating the results.


The DSA major trains students across the entire data analytics pipeline consisting of series of refinements including, but not limited to: identifying and integrating appropriate data; understanding the strengths and weaknesses of the data and its sources; extracting valuable insights by way of advanced visualization and inferential methods; and strategically communicating recommendations based upon that analysis that maximally inspire some person or group to take action. A defining feature of this major is the senior-year capstone, where students will work in teams to apply advanced methods of interactive data visualization and machine-learning to address real-world problems. As such, this major provides students a unique opportunity to develop a multi-dimensional skillset - one that integrates core quantitative and computational capabilities with a broad understanding of societal context, ethical best practices, and real-world applications.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Data Science and Analytics, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • MATH 012 or MATH 022
  • DSA 002
  • ECON 001 or COGS 001
  • ECON 010
  • PHIL 002 or PHIL 003


Additional Major Preparation Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • DSA 001
  • MIST 050 or MIST 070


*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Computer Science: Comp Science A score of 5 exempts CSE 022
  • An AP Economics: Both Macroeconomics And Microeconomics score of 4 or 5 exempts ECON 001
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 higher exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 or MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB: score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010

majors.major: DATA SCIENCE AND ANALYTICS, Policy Analytics Emphasis, B.A. (Transfer Starting Fall 2026)
general_titles: The Data Science and Analytics Major
general_texts:
The Data Science and Analytics (DSA) major-anticipated to be available for Transfer Students in Fall 2026- addresses the increasing demand for adept data analysts by combining coursework in applied data science with coursework in economics and cognitive, political and management science - areas where real-world problem solving increasingly relies on data-driven analysis to inform decision-making.


The reason for the increasing workforce demand is the ubiquity of data, which are generated everywhere, and increasingly envelop our human experience by mediating our interactions with the natural, social, and built world. Yet despite their prevalence, data are not necessarily generated in a way that are immediately usable or valuable. Instead, they require refinement, reformatting and critical analysis before they can be converted into something informative. In order to extract value that an individual or organization might use in order to make a decision-- i.e., raise or lower a tax, hire or dismiss within a department, or invest or divest in a particular sector - one needs to understand how to appropriately and ethnically apply methods of data science for harnessing and classifying the data, along with the methods of data analytics for extracting actionable insights and effectively communicating the results.


The DSA major trains students across the entire data analytics pipeline consisting of series of refinements including, but not limited to: identifying and integrating appropriate data; understanding the strengths and weaknesses of the data and its sources; extracting valuable insights by way of advanced visualization and inferential methods; and strategically communicating recommendations based upon that analysis that maximally inspire some person or group to take action. A defining feature of this major is the senior-year capstone, where students will work in teams to apply advanced methods of interactive data visualization and machine-learning to address real-world problems. As such, this major provides students a unique opportunity to develop a multi-dimensional skillset - one that integrates core quantitative and computational capabilities with a broad understanding of societal context, ethical best practices, and real-world applications.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Data Science and Analytics, Policy Analytics Emphasis B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • MATH 012 or MATH 022
  • DSA 002
  • ECON 001 or COGS 001
  • ECON 010
  • PHIL 002 or PHIL 003


Additional Major Preparation Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • DSA 001
  • MIST 050 or MIST 070


*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Computer Science: Comp Science A score of 5 exempts CSE 022
  • An AP Economics: Both Macroeconomics And Microeconomics score of 4 or 5 exempts ECON 001
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 higher exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 or MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB: score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010

majors.major: DATA SCIENCE AND COMPUTING, Applied Mathematics Emphasis, B.S. (Transfer Starting Fall 2026)
general_titles: The Data Science and Computing Major
general_texts:
What is Data Science and Computing?


Nearly every feature of our society has been touched by the accumulation of data at different scales and, as such, data science the analysis and extraction of knowledge and meaning from data has become an established field and highly sought-after career. The ability to collect, model and analyze vast volumes of data has transformed scientific, commercial, and humanitarian enterprises and institutions, bringing significant advances such as individualized cancer therapies and facial recognition-based security technologies. However, the abundant use and sharing of data and algorithms raise pressing ethical challenges.


The Data Science and Computing Program major and minor inclusively empower UC Merced undergraduates to creatively and ethically apply data science mastery to any scientific domain of study at UC Merced, as well as to the academic, commercial, and humanitarian pursuits of their dreams.


Graduates will be prepared to tackle real-world problems with foundational skills and knowledge in communication, ethics, computing, statistics, machine learning and domain applications. Graduates will be prepared to enter careers in technology, public service, academic research, and many other fields where rigorous and ethical analysis of large data sets is crucial to success. The program's curriculum is tailor-made for data scientists, providing the specific core skills and knowledge that are sought after by employers seeking to hire data science graduates.


The Data Science and Computing Major includes domain specializations for every major program within the School of Natural Sciences as well as programs in other schools. Students may design their own custom domain specializations. The Data Science and Computing Minor provides a calculus-free path to Data Science education that can be flexibly combined with any other Major on campus.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Data Science and Computing, Applied Mathematics Emphasis, B.S.  major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.8 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. majors.major: DATA SCIENCE AND COMPUTING, Physics Emphasis, B.S. (Transfer Starting Fall 2026)
general_titles: THE DATA SCIENCE AND COMPUTING MAJOR
general_texts:
What is Data Science and Computing?


Nearly every feature of our society has been touched by the accumulation of data at different scales and, as such, data science the analysis and extraction of knowledge and meaning from data has become an established field and highly sought-after career. The ability to collect, model and analyze vast volumes of data has transformed scientific, commercial, and humanitarian enterprises and institutions, bringing significant advances such as individualized cancer therapies and facial recognition-based security technologies. However, the abundant use and sharing of data and algorithms raise pressing ethical challenges.


The Data Science and Computing Program major and minor inclusively empower UC Merced undergraduates to creatively and ethically apply data science mastery to any scientific domain of study at UC Merced, as well as to the academic, commercial, and humanitarian pursuits of their dreams.


Graduates will be prepared to tackle real-world problems with foundational skills and knowledge in communication, ethics, computing, statistics, machine learning and domain applications. Graduates will be prepared to enter careers in technology, public service, academic research, and many other fields where rigorous and ethical analysis of large data sets is crucial to success. The program's curriculum is tailor-made for data scientists, providing the specific core skills and knowledge that are sought after by employers seeking to hire data science graduates.


The Data Science and Computing Major includes domain specializations for every major program within the School of Natural Sciences as well as programs in other schools. Students may design their own custom domain specializations. The Data Science and Computing Minor provides a calculus-free path to Data Science education that can be flexibly combined with any other Major on campus.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!

 

For admission to the Data Science and Computing, Physics Emphasis, B.S.  major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.8 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all Major Preparation courses require a "C" or better.

  • MATH 011 or MATH 021

  • DSC 008

  • MATH 032
  • PHYS 008 & PHYS 008L or PHYS 018 & 018L
  • PHYS 009 & PHYS 009L or PHYS 019 & 019L
  • PHYS 010

 

AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts Math 021 and Math 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB score of 3 or higher exempts Math 021
  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 & CHEM 002L and CHEM 010 & CHEM 010L
  • An AP Computer Science: Comp Science A score of 5 exempts CSE 022
  • An AP Physics: Physics C: Mechanics score of 5 exempts PHYS 008 and PHYS 008L

general_texts:
Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Environmental Humanities, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. All major preparation courses requires a "C-" or better.


*Required Transfer Selection Criteria:

  • At least two UC Transferable courses from in any of the following topics: Environmental, Green or Ecological Literature; Creative Writing; Professional Writing; Environmental Studies; Sociology, Bioethics ; Environmental Justice; Biology; Environmental Science; Environmental Engineering; Ecology; Public Health

Additional Major Preparation Courses:

  • Environmental Communications: EH 001
  • Environmental Literature: Complete one course - ENG 019, ENG 058, ENG 059, ENG 060, ENG 067
  • Social Justice Literature: Complete one course- ENG 031, ENG 032, ENG 033, ENG 034, ENG 061, ENG 062, ENG 063, ENG 064, ENG 071, ENG 089. ESS/CRES/MIST 011
  • Environmental Science: Complete two courses- COGS 013, ENGR 096, ESS 002, ESS 010, ESS 015, BIO/ESS 034, BIO/ESS 043, ESS 050, ENVE 010, ENVE 020, ENVE 030, PHYS 001


*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.

Please read the catalog page for more information about the Environmental Humanities, B.A. major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.

1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete IGETC in order to prepare for work within the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts (SSHA). IGETC courses may double count with the major courses listed below. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.

Beginning Fall 2026, UC Merced is pleased to announce Environmental Humanities, B.A. program will be available to transfer applicants. The UC Merced Environmental Humanities major lays the foundation for becoming an environmental communicator. The "toolkit" you'll develop in this program includes storytelling, creativity, critical thinking, and audience sensitivity, which are applicable to producing inspirational engaging content for our society's most pressing environmental and social justice issues. These skills are not only necessary for creating a better world but also rare and valuable skills that employers today are looking for.

majors.major: ENVIRONMENTAL SYSTEMS SCIENCE, Earth and Climate Science Emphasis, B.S.
general_texts:
Effective Spring 2023, the Environmental Systems Science major will accept a one-year sequence of Algebra/Trigonometry-based physics completed at another institution, in addition to calculus-based physics offered at community colleges. Although not a direct course equivalent, the one-year sequence of Algebra/Trigonometry-based physics can be substituted for the major requirements for PHYS 018/018L and PHYS 019/019L. Students who only have one semester of Algebra/Trigonometry-based physics will not meet the prereqs for PHYS 009 and 019 and would have to complete the series at a Community College.


For students completing the sequence at a California Community College, courses with C-IDs PHYS 105 and PHYS 110 or PHYS 100 S will be accepted towards the requirement. Students electing to meet the requirement with Algebra/Trigonometry-based physics may be unable to take advanced courses in biophysics and other courses requiring calculus-based physics. Please meet with your Community College Academic Counselor to discuss the Algebra/Trigonometry-based physics course option further.

For admission to the Environmental Systems Science, Earth and Climate Science Emphasis, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.8 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses For Transfer:

  • CHEM 002 & 002L
  • CHEM 010 & 010L
  • MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • PHYS 018 & PHYS 018L* or PHYS 008 & PHYS 008L


* Please scroll below for information about how Algebra/Trigonometry based Physics courses can be accepted for admissions purposes.


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended Prior to Transfer:

  • Complete one Biological or Environmental Systems Science Course: ESS 001 or ESS 002 or BIO 005 or BIO 012 (equivalent to BIO 001)
  • Complete one lower division Environmental Systems Science Course: *ESS 010 or *ESS 015 or *ESS 020 or *ESS 034 or ESS 040 or ESS 043 or ESS 050 or ESS 060 or ESS 065
  • *Indicating courses recommended for the Earth and Climate Science emphasis track.
  • Complete one Computer Science Course: CSE 005 or CSE 019 or CSE 022 or DSC 011
  • Complete the additional Mathematics Requirement: MATH 012 or MATH 022
  • Complete one Probability and Statistics Course: BIO 018 or ECON 010 or PSY 010 or MATH 032
  • Complete the additional Physics Requirement: PHYS 019 & PHYS 019L or PHYS 009 & PHYS 009L
  • Complete one additional lower-division Natural Sciences or Engineering courses. Relevant courses outside of Natural Sciences or Engineering may be allowed with approval.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Biology score of 4 or 5 exempts BIO 005
  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 and CHEM 010
  • An AP Environmental Sciences score of 4 or 5 exempts ESS 001
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 OR MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 exempts MATH 11 OR MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 OR MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB score 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Physics: Physics C: Mechanics score of 5 exempts PHYS 008 and PHYS 008L or PHYS 018 and PHYS 018L
  • An AP Statistics score of 4 exempts BIO 018 or PSY 010
  • An AP Statistics score of 5 exempts ECON 010


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

Please read the catalog page for more information about the Environmental Systems Science, Earth and Climate Science Emphasis major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.


Prior to Transferring to UC Merced, please be advised of the following for Junior Transfers:


1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements.


IGETC/Cal-GETC is acceptable for students planning to transfer into the School of Natural Sciences. Students are encouraged to prioritize as much lower-division major preparation as possible before transferring to ensure a smooth transition and timely progress toward their degree.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

majors.major: GLOBAL ARTS STUDIES, B.A.
general_texts:
Between the Fall 2025 and Fall 2027 application cycles, the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts

will not require transfer students to complete major specific selection criteria to be admitted to this major*.

Students wanting to enroll in this major will be admitted using UC Merced's general transfer requirements**.


* This only applies to certain SSHA majors.

** The General Transfer Requirements are as follows:


Units and GPA

  • Complete 60 semester (90 quarter) units of UC-transferable college credit
  • Earn a minimum grade point average of 2.40 (nonresident: 2.80) in UC-transferable courses
  • Take no more than 14 semester (21 quarter) units as Pass/Not Pass


Course Requirements/Subject Requirements

Complete the following seven-course pattern, earning a grade of C- or better in each course:

  • Two transferable English composition courses
  • One transferable mathematical concepts and quantitative reasoning course that has a published prerequisite of intermediate algebra
  • Four transferable courses chosen from at least two of the following areas: Arts and Humanities, Behavioral and Social Sciences, Biological and Physical Sciences


While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.

Recommended, but not Required Prior to Transfer:

  • Complete the following Common Foundations Courses: GASP 002, GASP 003, GASP 004
  • Complete one course from the following course ranges: GASP 006, GASP 007 or GASP 050-089
  • Music or Dance Requirement/Ensemble: Complete four units chosen from the following ranges: GASP 025-039 (GASP 125-139 upper division courses can also count)
  • Visual Arts Studio: Complete four units chosen from the following course ranges: GASP 010-029 (GASP 110-129 upper division courses can also count)
  • Studio/Ensemble Elective: Complete four units chosen from the following course ranges: GASP 010-049 (GASP 110-149 upper division courses can also count)


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade, and specifically may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • AP Studio Art: Drawing: score of 4 or 5 exempts one (1) course in GASP to count towards one Visual Arts Course for the GASP Major.
  • AP Studio Art: 2-D Design: score of 4 or 5 exempts one (1) course in GASP to count towards one Visual Arts Course for the GASP Major.
  • AP Studio Art: 3-D Design: score of 4 or 5 exempts one (1) course in GASP to count towards one Visual Arts Course for the GASP Major.
  • AP Art History: score of 4 or 5 exempts one (1) course in GASP to count toward one lower division course within the GASP Major.


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations


Please read the catalog page for more information about the Global Arts Studies major.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete IGETC in order to prepare for work within the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts (SSHA). IGETC courses may double count with the major courses listed below. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. For Admissions to the Literatures in English, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.4 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes, all major preparation courses require a "C-" or better.


REQUIRED: Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • Complete at least two UC-Transferable courses in English, Literature or English Literature
  1. These courses may also fulfill the "Additional Major Preparation courses" listed below.


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer


  • Complete the following Introductory course: ENG 010*
  • Complete one lower division seminar course chosen from ENG 050-090.
  • Complete two additional lower division courses chosen from ENG 011-090 (One course may be substituted with a course chosen from ENG 105 -189 (these are upper division courses that you can compete upon transfer at UC Merced) or WRI 025 or GASP 041A, please refer to the catalog)


* Please note, in cases where a course is equivalent to both WRI 010 (College Reading and Composition) and ENG 010 (Foundations of Literary Studies), maximum credit is for only one course. The awarded credit will first default to WRI 010 as it satisfies an Admissions Requirement. Please visit the Prefix Agreement on ASSIST.org to view your college articulation with WRI 010.


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.

majors.major: MANAGEMENT OF INNOVATION, SUSTAINABILITY AND TECHNOLOGY, Custom Emphasis, B.A.
general_titles: Management of Innovation, Sustainability and Technology Major
general_texts:
Management of Innovation, Sustainability and Technology (MIST)

The undergraduate major in Management of Innovation, Sustainability and Technology (MIST) develops a multidimensional skillset that combines leadership, organizations, entrepreneurship, finance, policy, data analytics, technology management and sustainable innovation. Students gain an integrated understanding of how to design sustainable and equitable solutions by applying teamwork and technology and by balancing people, planet and profit considerations.


Graduates of the program acquire applied skills in communication, leadership, operations and planning that can be used across public, private and nonprofit settings. By combining innovation, sustainability and technology, MIST prepares students to recognize entrepreneurial opportunities, develop action plans grounded in ethical and environmental principles and design scalable and equitable solutions for complex challenges such as climate change and the management of social, food and energy systems.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Management of Innovation, Sustainability and Technology, Custom Emphasis, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.4 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • MATH 005, MATH 011 or MATH 021


Additional Major Preparation Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • Data Analytics Requirement: MIST 060 or DSA 001
  • Additional Major prep: MIST 001, ENGR 096
  • MIST Fundamentals: ESS 043 or MIST 040
  • Custom Emphasis Requirement: Complete two of the following- ESS 002, ENG/EH 001 , MIST/ESS 011, MIST 50, MIST 070, ENVE 020
  • Elective Requirement: Complete four of the following- CSE 015, DSA 002, ECON 005, ECON 007, ESS 015, ESS 034 (Only Lower Division options shown)


*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 higher exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 or MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB: score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

Please read the catalog page for more information about the Management of Innovation, Sustainability and Technology major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.


Prior to Transferring to UC Merced, please be advised of the following for Junior Transfers:


1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements.


Please note the School of Engineering strongly discourages IGETC, but accepts it; students are encouraged to focus primarily on lower division major preparation and fulfilling UCM minimum admissions requirements. If you elect to complete IGETC, the courses may double count with the major courses listed below. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.

majors.major: NEUROSCIENCE, B.A. (Transfer Starting Fall 2027)
general_texts: The School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts at UC Merced is pleased to announce the Bachelor of Arts major in Neuroscience. Beginning in Fall 2027, the curriculum for this major is currently under development. More information will be added to these pages as it becomes available.

The Neuroscience program is designed so that the first 2 years of required courses can all be met through community college transfer.


The UC Merced Neuroscience program values transfer students as part of our community and classrooms (minimum 2.4 GPA for California residents and or 2.8 for non-residents). For students entering through TAG, additional requirements apply including a Minimum transferable unit GPA of 3.0. 


In addition to the general education requirements, transfer students to the B.A. program will be required to complete courses equivalent to:

BIO 011: Introduction to Molecular Biology Units: 4

BIO 011L: Introduction to Molecular Biology Lab Units: 1

CHEM 001: Preparatory Chemistry Units: 3

CHEM 002 : General Chemistry I Units: 4

CHEM 010: General Chemistry II Units: 4

CSE 019: Introduction to Computing Units: 4

MATH 005: Preparatory Calculus Units: 4

MATH 011: Calculus I Units: 4 or MATH 021: Calculus I for Physical Sciences and Engineering

PSY 001: Introduction to Psychology Units: 4

majors.major: PHILOSOPHY, B.A.
general_texts:
Between the Fall 2025 and Fall 2027 application cycles, the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts

will not require transfer students to complete major specific selection criteria to be admitted to this major*.

Students wanting to enroll in this major will be admitted using UC Merced's general transfer requirements**.


* This only applies to certain SSHA majors.

** The General Transfer Requirements are as follows:


Units and GPA

  • Complete 60 semester (90 quarter) units of UC-transferable college credit
  • Earn a minimum grade point average of 2.40 (nonresident: 2.80) in UC-transferable courses
  • Take no more than 14 semester (21 quarter) units as Pass/Not Pass


Course Requirements/Subject Requirements

Complete the following seven-course pattern, earning a grade of C- or better in each course:

  • Two transferable English composition courses
  • One transferable mathematical concepts and quantitative reasoning course that has a published prerequisite of intermediate algebra
  • Four transferable courses chosen from at least two of the following areas: Arts and Humanities, Behavioral and Social Sciences, Biological and Physical Sciences


While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.

Recommended, but not Required Prior to Transfer:

  • PHIL 001
  • PHIL 004 or PHIL 005
  • Complete one additional Introductory course from the following: PHIL 002, PHIL 003, PHIL 008, PHIL 009


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


Please read the catalog page for more information about the Philosophy major.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

IGETC/Cal-GETC is acceptable for students planning to transfer into the School of Natural Sciences. Students are encouraged to prioritize as much lower-division major preparation as possible before transferring to ensure a smooth transition and timely progress toward their degree.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For admission to the Physics, Astrophysics Emphasis, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 2.8 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by spring prior to fall enrollment or by fall prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED Major Preparation Courses For Transfer:

  • MATH 021
  • MATH 022
  • PHYS 008 & PHYS 008L
  • PHYS 009 & PHYS 009L


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended Prior to Transfer:

  • CHEM 002 & 002L
  • PHYS 010*, MATH 023**, MATH 024**, MATH 032
  • BIOE 021 or CSE 019 or CSE 022 or DSC 011 or ME 021


* PHYS 010 is a prerequisite to PHYS 137 (Quantum Mechanics Core) which is an Upper Division required course. Completing PHYS 010 before transfer can help speed up time to graduation.

** MATH 023 and MATH 024 are prerequisites for upper division course in the major. Completing them before transfer can help speed up time to graduation.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 & 002L and CHEM 010 & 010L
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 021

majors.major: POLITICAL SCIENCE, American Politics Emphasis, B.A.
general_texts:
Between the Fall 2025 and Fall 2027 application cycles, the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts

will not require transfer students to complete major specific selection criteria to be admitted to this major*.

Students wanting to enroll in this major will be admitted using UC Merced's general transfer requirements**.


* This only applies to certain SSHA majors.

** The General Transfer Requirements are as follows:


Units and GPA

  • Complete 60 semester (90 quarter) units of UC-transferable college credit
  • Earn a minimum grade point average of 2.40 (nonresident: 2.80) in UC-transferable courses
  • Take no more than 14 semester (21 quarter) units as Pass/Not Pass


Course Requirements/Subject Requirements

Complete the following seven-course pattern, earning a grade of C- or better in each course:

  • Two transferable English composition courses
  • One transferable mathematical concepts and quantitative reasoning course that has a published prerequisite of intermediate algebra
  • Four transferable courses chosen from at least two of the following areas: Arts and Humanities, Behavioral and Social Sciences, Biological and Physical Sciences


While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.

Recommended, but not Required Prior to Transfer:

  • POLI 001

And at least one course chosen from:

  • POLI 003*
  • POLI 005*

(*which will also fulfill the Additional courses listed below).

  • POLI 010
  • Complete two courses chosen from the following: POLI 002, 003, 005, 006, 009


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Government & Politics: United States: score of 4 or 5 exempts POLI 001
  • An AP Government & Politics: Comparative: score of 4 or 5 exempts POLI 003


UC Merced Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) credit policies are detailed in the link below:

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations


Please read the catalog page for more information about the Political Science major.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

While major courses are not required for admissions, it is highly recommended to complete as many of the recommended major preparatory courses as possible before transferring to ensure timely progress to degree. Any major courses not completed prior to enrollment at UC Merced must be completed upon enrollment at UC Merced to ensure time to degree and graduation.

  • POLI 010

general_texts:
Please read the catalog page for more information about the Public Health major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.


Prior to Transferring to UC Merced, please be advised of the following for Junior Transfers:


1) WRI 001 and WRI 010 are admissions requirements: WRI 001 is fulfilled by IGETC 1A - English Composition. WRI 010 is fulfilled by IGETC 1B - Critical Thinking/English Composition. Please scroll towards the bottom of the agreement to find the articulation for each course.


2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): Public Health majors are required to complete IGETC Certification for admissions. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more about the IGETC areas & course requirements along with the Certification process.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.


5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

Thank you for your interest in UC Merced!


For Admissions to the Public Health, B.A. major, students must earn an overall transferable GPA of 3.0 or better, and must complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. All Major Preparation courses require a "C" or better.


REQUIRED: Major Preparation Courses for Transfer:

  • PH 010 OR PSY 010* (Either of the courses will satisfy the Statistics Requirement for the major preparation courses listed below)
  • IGETC Certification (Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more about the requirements and process)


*Beginning with fall 2025 applicants, courses equivalent to PH 010 will be the only option to meet the Statistics requirement.


Strongly recommended, but not required for Admission:

  • The Lower division Core courses in the "Additional Major Preparation courses" area (PH 001, PH 005, and BIO 003).
  • PSY 001 and ANTH 001 are not required for the major but are recommended to complete at your Community College to prepare for Upper Division Public Health courses when you transfer to UC Merced. Since IGETC Certification is required for admissions for this major, please consult with your Community College Counselor whether the articulated course for PSY 001 and/or ANTH 001 would count towards an IGETC Area.


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • Complete the Lower Division Major Core courses: PH 001 and PH 005 and BIO 003
  • Complete one Statistics Requirement course: PH 010 OR PSY 010 ( PSY 010 also satisfies the Required Major Preparation course for Transfer)
  • Additional Electives (Complete two): Almost all electives are Upper Division courses except for BIO 060 & GEOG 002 (Crosslisted with: HS 002) lower division courses, please refer to the catalog.


Department Note: After matriculating to UC Merced, transfer students may not be able to complete this major within four semesters. The coursework required may take a minimum of five semesters.


Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.


AP Exam Score & Course Exemptions

  • An AP Psychology score of 4 or 5 exempts PSY 001
  • An AP Statistics score of 4 exempts PH 010 or PSY 010

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

general_texts:

5. Changes to this Agreements: Major requirements are subject to change from one academic year to the next. Newly-articulated courses are added on a rolling basis, and articulated courses can be revised. Visit ASSIST every semester for the latest information and consult with an Academic Counselor at your institution on a regular basis.


For more questions about admissions, please email: transfer@ucmerced.edu.

The Public Health, B.S. major is designed to impart a basic understanding of Public Health built on a foundation of population health, biology, epidemiology, and biostatistics, and to provide Public Health majors with knowledge of public health principles. A B.S. in Public Health will prepare students for occupation in data management, public health practice, clinical and behavioral practice and research, non-profit leadership, as well as other professional roles that require graduate education.


For admission to the Public Health, B.S. major, students must earn an overall transferrable GPA of 3.0 or better, and complete classes articulated with the following UC Merced courses by the end of spring term prior to fall enrollment or by the end of fall term prior to spring enrollment. For Admission purposes all major preparation courses requires a "C" or better.


*REQUIRED major preparation courses:

  • IGETC Certification (Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more about the requirement and process)
  • PSY 010 or PH 010
  • BIO 011 and BIO 012
  • MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • CHEM 002 and CHEM 010

*Please continue to check ASSIST every year as this information is valid for the academic year listed on the top of the agreement.


Additional Major Preparation Courses: Recommended to be completed prior to Transfer:

  • Public Health Requirement: PH 001, PH 005, PH 010
  • Biology Requirement: BIO 011 and BIO 11L, BIO 12 and BIO 12L
  • Math Requirement: MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • Chemistry Requirement: CHEM 002 and CHEM 002L, CHEM 010 and CHEM 010L
  • Elective Requirement: HS 002 (Only lower division option shown)


AP Exam Score Course Exemptions

  • An AP Chemistry score of 5 exempts CHEM 002 and CHEM 010
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus AB score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC score of 4 or 5 exempts MATH 011 and MATH 012 or MATH 021 and MATH 022
  • An AP Mathematics: Calculus BC Subscore AB: score of 3 or higher exempts MATH 011 or MATH 021
  • An AP Psychology score of 4 or 5 exempts PSY 001
  • An AP Statistics score of 4 exempts MATH 018 or PSY 010

Advance Placement (AP) and International Baccalaureate (IB) Examinations

general_titles: A NEW MAJOR: B.S. SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY AND ETHICS
general_texts: The School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts at UC Merced is pleased to announce the Bachelor of Science major in Science, Technology and Ethics. Beginning in Fall 2027, the curriculum for this major is currently under development. More information will be added to these pages as it becomes avilable.

Transfer students who wish to major in Science, Technology, and Ethics should complete the Intersegmental General Education Transfer Curriculum (IGETC) at their community college. To be admitted to the Science, Technology, and Ethics major transfer students must meet the following requirements: Applicants will, at the time of admission have completed at minimum one of the following courses (or their equivalent) with a C or better:


In addition to the general education requirements, transfer students to this program are required to complete courses equivalent to:

One of the following courses:

PHIL 002: Introduction to Ethics Units: 4

PHIL 003: Contemporary Moral Problems Units: 4


And one of the following courses:

ECON 010: Statistical Inference Units: 4

MATH 018: Statistics for Scientific Data Analysis Units: 4

MATH 032: Probability and Statistics Units: 4

PH 010: Introduction to Biostatistics Units: 4

PSY 010: Analysis of Psychological Data Units: 5


Additional Major Preparation Courses:

Introduction to Science, Technology, and Ethics: PHIL 006

Please read the catalog page for more information about the Science, Technology, and Ethics major.


In addition to the Major Selection Criteria, all Upper-Division Transfer applicants must meet minimum University of California admissions requirements. Visit https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/requirements for more specific UC Merced admissions information.

2) Transfer Admissions Guarantee (TAG): UC Merced is one of the six UC's that offers Transfer Admissions Guarantee. Please visit the TAG website for more information: https://admissions.ucmerced.edu/transfer/tag


3) General Education (GE Requirements): While general education is not required for admission, it can help speed up your time to graduation once you transfer to UC Merced. We highly recommend reviewing the Transfer Students: Satisfying General Education page in the catalog for a more extensive explanation of the requirements. Transfer students are strongly encouraged to complete IGETC in order to prepare for work within the School of Social Sciences, Humanities and Arts (SSHA). IGETC courses may double count with the major courses listed below. Please visit your Community College Counselor to learn more.


4. This agreement displays all lower-division (or Major Preparation) courses required in the major. UC Merced courses on the left, approved (articulated) transfer courses to the right.

  • At least one course from the following course ranges: SOC 011 - SOC 014 or SOC 016 - SOC 089

Courses in the major must be taken for a letter grade and may not be taken on a pass/no pass basis unless the course is only offered on a pass/no pass basis.
